app.api.user.views

Module Contents

Functions

post_user_data(context: app.api.user.schema.GetUser)

The post_user_data function is used to create a new user in the database.

get_user_data(request: fastapi.Request)

The get_user_data function returns the user data for a given user.

Attributes

router

app.api.user.views.router
async app.api.user.views.post_user_data(context: app.api.user.schema.GetUser)

The post_user_data function is used to create a new user in the database. It takes a context argument, which is an instance of schema.GetUser.

Parameters

context:schema.GetUser – Used to Pass the user data to the function.

Returns

A GetUserResponse object.

async app.api.user.views.get_user_data(request: fastapi.Request)

The get_user_data function returns the user data for a given user.

Parameters

request:Request – Used to Get the user object from the request.

Returns

A dictionary with the user’s username, email and is_superuser attributes.

async app.api.user.views.set_name(context: app.api.user.schema.UserUpdateName, request: fastapi.Request)

The set_name function updates the name of a user. It expects a full name ex. “Jory Lenz”

Parameters

  • context:schema.UserUpdateName – Used to Pass in the name.

  • request:Request – Used to Get the user id.

Returns

The new name.
